column4: ok.  i'm having a wifi problem.  i can use a wired connection straight to my router just fine.  i can connect to my wireless router just fine and network-manager even says i'm at 95-100% signal strength.  when i'm connected to wireless though my desktop internet doesnt work.  almost like i don't really have a connection.  everything worked fine with my wireless a couple weeks ago.
can you ping the router?
open up a shell, type "ping " then the address of the router
would that be 192.168.100.1?
I guess not.  I kept getting "Destination Net Unreachable" errors.
sounds like a problem with the router is most likely, has somebody mucked about with the wirless settings maybe?
actually.  I've never been able to change my wireless settings from the default.  the default admin password/username dont work.
so i can't get into the settings inside my router, but no one else can either.
since no one knows the name/password.
it could be that someone has gained access to the router wirelessly and guessed the username and pass
I have one of those, its blank user, password admin
i'll try that.  so once i'm there I should try to change the channel that it's running on?
& Jowi:  that doesn't work.  still can't get into my router settings.  tried the routers reset button as well.
ah, if you've reset it that completely wipes the routers memory
the essid will be linksys now, with no encrption
maybe the reset didn't work then because it's still coming up as the old name for the router.
are you connected to it by wires?
no.  when i'm on this wired connection i'm running an ethernet cord straight from my modem.
maybe try wiring straight into the router, and trying to access the routers control panel
i don't have enough eithernet cables.  only have the one.
just don't tell them that :P I do it all the time, just silently transpose windows instructions to linux ones :)
